resources.string: CloudKit Support Will be Removed in Next Release

Privacy Policy, ToS and EULA is updated due to removal of CloudKit Sync

YABA includes a custom keyboard, giving you quick access to your saved content without leaving your current app‚Äîfor example, your browser or a messaging app. Setting it up is a simple two-step process. Start with navigating to settings and finding the **Enable YABA Keyboard** option.

If everything went smoothly, YABA Keyboard is now ready to use. When your main keyboard is visible, tap the **Globe** icon at the bottom left to switch keyboards. You can also tap and hold the icon to see all your keyboards in a pop-up. If YABA Keyboard appears here, the setup is complete.
Once YABA Keyboard is open, you‚Äôll see a familiar interface. You can easily browse your folders and tags to access your bookmarks.

Tapping a bookmark automatically inserts its link into the currently focused text box. Use the buttons in the top-right corner to delete the link or confirm the paste. Depending on the app, confirming may trigger a search, send a message, or perform another action.

After tapping **Enable YABA Keyboard**, you‚Äôll be taken to YABA‚Äôs settings on your device. Here you can also change the app‚Äôs language or enable/disable local network access. To continue setup, tap **Keyboards**.
You‚Äôll see two options here. To see YABA as a keyboard in a later step, make sure to enable both.

When enabling the second option, a system pop-up will appear. Don‚Äôt worry‚ÄîYABA will never collect your data or send anything to a remote server, as promised during onboarding. To use YABA as a keyboard, tap **Allow**. You can always review the open-source codebase to see exactly how YABA Keyboard works and confirm that no data is ever collected.
Now you‚Äôre ready for the second step. Go back to your device settings, find the **General** tab, and tap it.
In there, you have to find ‚ÄúKeyboard‚Äù and tap it.
When you reach **Keyboards**, you‚Äôll see your existing keyboards. If YABA is already listed, you‚Äôre all set. If not, tap **Add New Keyboard**.

In the pop-up, look under **Third-Party Keyboards**. YABA should appear here if you enabled both options in the previous step. Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt see it right away‚Äîjust make sure both options are enabled.
Once YABA is added, you can use the Edit button to change its order among your keyboards.

Setting up reminders in YABA is simple. In the bookmark details, you‚Äôll find several options‚Äîon Mac they‚Äôre shown directly, while on iOS/iPad you can tap the three dots icon for more. On all devices, tap the yellow **bell** icon to create a reminder.
After tapping, a pop-up will appear where you can select a time for your reminder. Tap Done to save it.

YABA only asks for permissions when they‚Äôre truly needed. The first time you set up a reminder, you‚Äôll see a prompt asking for notification access. Simply tap **Allow** to let YABA send your reminder notifications. Don‚Äôt worry‚ÄîYABA will never send notifications for anything else.
Once set up, you‚Äôll see a confirmation of your reminder, and the scheduled time will appear as the last item in the bookmark‚Äôs info section.
You can cancel a reminder anytime by swiping its tile. When you tap **Delete**, a confirmation pop-up will appear to prevent accidental cancellations.
When your reminder triggers, YABA will notify you to return to your bookmark‚Äîsometimes with a funny message to keep things light. üòâ

When sharing content, you‚Äôll see the YABA icon in the share pop-up. YABA works with almost any app, and if the shared content includes a link, it will automatically open YABA‚Äôs bookmark creation view.
The first time you use sharing, YABA may not appear in the share pop-up. Simply swipe to the end of the app list and tap the **three dots icon** to manage and enable YABA.
After tapping the three dots icon, you‚Äôll see a list of available apps. Simply add YABA by tapping the green plus button next to it.
Once added, you can reorder the apps using the sliders on the right. Feel free to move YABA to the top for quicker access. üòâ

Once YABA is added to your shareable apps, it will always appear as an option when sharing links. Selecting YABA opens a pop-up to save your bookmark. YABA will automatically fetch details like the image, title, and description, but we recommend writing your own title and description for easier recall and search later. In this pop-up, you can also choose a folder for your bookmark (if none is selected, it will be saved under **Uncategorized**) and add tags for better organization. You can even create new folders and tags on the spot.
If you prefer a quicker flow, you can enable **Simple Share Sheet** mode in Settings to streamline the process.

Once enabled, you‚Äôll experience a simpler flow. The process works the same in the background‚ÄîYABA will still fetch content automatically. All you need to do is set a title for your bookmark (recommended for easier search, even though it‚Äôs auto-filled). \n\nBookmarks saved through Simple Share Sheet are placed in the Uncategorized folder without tags. In future updates, AI-powered features (still free) are planned to make this smoother, but for now you‚Äôll need to organize these bookmarks manually in the app.

Some apps may hide the native share sheet since they offer their own bookmarking features. But YABA is usually a better option üòé, so you might need to navigate a bit to find it. For example, in the Reddit app, tapping Share brings up a menu where you‚Äôll need to tap the three dots icon to access YABA.

Sometimes the native share sheet is nested deeper. For example, in the Reddit app, tapping the three dots opens a custom share sheet, and you may need to tap the three dots again to reach the native share sheet. It‚Äôs not the most convenient, but if you don‚Äôt see YABA, just keep tapping the three dots until it appears. üòâ

Quickly add bookmarks to YABA with **‚åò‚áßY (Command + Shift + Y)**. A window will pop up for you to paste your link. YABA will fetch the title automatically within seconds, but we recommend writing your own title to make finding it later even easier.

To use the quick key **(‚åò‚áßY)** and open the quick share/save pop-up, the menu bar item must be running. The menu bar item also makes it easy to browse your recently saved bookmarks or open the quick share/save pop-up with a single click.
You can enable or disable the menu bar item anytime in Settings.

Syncing is a core feature of YABA‚Äîand a big reason it stays free. YABA doesn‚Äôt rely on servers, so your data is never stored elsewhere‚Äîyou have full ownership at all times. Because YABA supports devices beyond the Apple ecosystem, we needed a cost-free solution that still keeps your data fully yours. The result is a local, multicast-based synchronization system. Think of it like exporting your content, emailing it to yourself, and importing it on another device‚Äîbut fully automated for you. üòâ To start syncing, your device needs a name. This is usually set after onboarding or when you relaunch YABA, but you can change it anytime in Settings.

On all devices, Sync is easy to access‚Äîat the top left of your Home Screen on mobile, or in the sidebar on tablets and computers. Once opened, a local server will automatically search for and detect your devices on the current network.

The first time you use Sync, YABA will ask for permission to access the Local Network. This must be enabled for Sync to work. If you deny it, you‚Äôll need to manually enable Local Network access for YABA in your device‚Äôs Settings, as YABA is not allowed to request it again.

Once allowed, you‚Äôll see a screen with instructions and a list of devices on your network. To make your other devices visible, ensure they‚Äôre connected to the same network and have the Sync screen open. An active internet connection isn‚Äôt required‚Äîconnecting through the same hotspot is enough for YABA to discover your devices.
When your devices are on the same network and the Sync screen is open, they‚Äôll appear in the list of **Available Devices**.

When you select a device, it will receive a sync request. This step ensures you don‚Äôt accidentally connect to other devices on the same network, protecting you from unwanted access. Once the request is accepted, synchronization begins automatically.
When syncing is complete, a toast message will confirm that it was successful.

In Settings, you‚Äôll find the option **Sync Without Deletes**, which changes how syncing behaves across your devices. Since sync happens between two devices at a time, let‚Äôs call them Device A and Device B:"

**Both devices: option disabled** ‚Üí

- All deletions are synced. Both devices end up with the same content (including removed items).

**Both devices: option enabled** ‚Üí

- Deletions are skipped. Each device transfers its data to the other, so deleted items reappear.
Useful for recovering from accidental deletes or transferring content without losses.

**Device A enabled, Device B disabled** ‚Üí

- Device A skips deletions from B but accepts all of B‚Äôs content.

- Device B processes deletions from A normally.
Useful if you want one device to act as a full archive while another stays more curated.

You can experiment with these settings to find the setup that works best for you.
Almost everything in YABA is interactive‚Äîyou can swipe on many items to reveal additional options.
You can also tap and hold (or use a two-finger tap for Mac) on any item to open a pop-up menu with the same options as swiping.
You can delete announcements by swiping, using a two-finger tap on Mac, or tapping the trash icon. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîyou can always view past announcements in Settings.
You can add a quick launcher for YABA to your Control Center on all devices, and even place it on the lock screen of your iPhone or iPad.
On Mac and iPad, you can easily resize panes by dragging their edges. This works for both the sidebar and the content/detail dividers.

YABA widgets make it easy to quickly open your favorite content from folders or tags, or to view your most recently saved bookmarks. Adding a widget is simple‚Äîjust press and hold anywhere on your home screen until the icons start jiggling.

When the icons begin to jiggle, the next step depends on your iOS version. On iOS 26, tap **Edit** in the top-left corner and select **Add Widget** from the pop-up. On iOS 18, tap the **+** button in the top-left corner, rest is the same.

After tapping, a pop-up will appear showing all available widgets. Search for **YABA** to see its options. You‚Äôll find two types of widgets: **Collection Widgets**, available in two sizes, which let you quickly open a favorite folder or tag from your Home Screen; and the **Bookmark Widget**, which shows the most recently saved bookmarks from a chosen folder or tag.
Once a widget is added, press and hold on it to open a pop-up, then select **Edit Widget** to customize it.
All YABA widgets include the option to select a folder or tag. When you tap this setting, you‚Äôll see your folders and tags listed in order‚Äîjust choose the one you want to link to the widget.

Finally, there‚Äôs an extra option called **Recents**, which shows the five most recently saved bookmarks across all of your folders. This gives you a quick glance at your latest saves and an easy way to jump back to them.

YABA widgets make it easy to quickly open your favorite content from folders or tags, or to view your most recently saved bookmarks. Adding a widget is simple‚Äîjust double click (click with two fingers) anywhere on your desktop to see the options menu, and click on **Edit Widgets‚Ä¶**.

After clicking, a pop-up will appear showing all available widgets. Search for **YABA** to see its options. You‚Äôll find two types of widgets: **Collection Widgets**, which let you quickly open a favorite folder or tag from your Home Screen; and the **Bookmark Widget**, which shows the most recently saved bookmarks from a chosen folder or tag. Both widgets are available in two different sizes.
Once a widget is added, double click (click with two fingers) on it to open the options menu, then select **Edit YABA‚Ä¶** to customize it.
All YABA widgets include the option to select a folder or tag. When you click this setting, you‚Äôll see your folders and tags listed in order‚Äîjust choose the one you want to link to the widget.

Finally, there‚Äôs an extra option called **Recents**, which shows the five most recently saved bookmarks across all of your folders. This gives you a quick glance at your latest saves and an easy way to jump back to them.
Games, media, communication, and cultural content
Personal life, health, and daily activities
Switch to docked keyboard to use or press the button below to switch your other keyboards

Read before proceeding üöÄ

We couldn‚Äôt automatically parse your CSV file ‚Äî but that‚Äôs totally okay! You‚Äôre just a few steps away from bringing your bookmarks in.

This mapper screen lets you tell us which columns mean what ‚Äî and once you match your data correctly, we‚Äôll handle the rest! We‚Äôll only import the bookmarks and safely place them in a new folder named with the current date and time.

The only required field is the link. If a title is missing, we‚Äôll default them to the link. If no creation date is provided, we‚Äôll use today‚Äôs date. Other fields like description, type or media URLs can be empty or skipped altogether.

You can relax knowing that your data is safe and the import is flexible ‚Äî no perfect formatting required.

Read before proceeding ‚ú® We couldn‚Äôt automatically read your HTML file ‚Äî but don‚Äôt worry, you‚Äôre almost there! Most browsers like Chrome, Safari, and Firefox export bookmarks in a standard format that YABA supports. Just make sure you exported the file directly from your browser (usually via ‚ÄúExport Bookmarks‚Äù or ‚ÄúExport as HTML‚Äù). YABA expects links in this format:
Bookmark Title Don‚Äôt forget that tags and icons are not exported to the HTML document!. üìÑ Example of a supported HTML format: Bookmarks

Bookmarks

My Folder

Example Site
Another Site

If your file looks similar to this and you're still seeing issues, try re-exporting and uploading again.

Read before proceeding ‚ú®

We couldn‚Äôt parse your JSON file automatically ‚Äî but don‚Äôt worry, you‚Äôre very close! While we couldn‚Äôt match the structure upfront, you can still ensure it‚Äôs importable by following the expected format below.

Your bookmarks (and even collections!) will be imported and organized smartly. If no collections are present, we‚Äôll neatly place all bookmarks inside a folder named with the current date and time.

The only required field is the link. If label is missing, we‚Äôll default it to using the link. For missing timestamps, we‚Äôll use the current time.

You don‚Äôt need to include every field ‚Äî we‚Äôll gracefully handle missing optional ones. If your JSON follows the structure below, you're good to go!
For sync purposes, you have to give a name to this device. Be creative, be unique, this is your device in the end üòÑ.\n\nYou can always set your device name again in the settings.
Seems like no bookmarks have added yet! Use the button below to add your first bookmark.

Select a collection to start exploring your bookmarks
It seems like you have not created any tags yet! Tap the + button to create your first tag.
Your brain saved this for a reason

Your digital world is now easier to save, search, and organize.

Start exploring ‚Äî collect bookmarks you love, tag them smartly, and let YABA bring clarity to your content.

All is yours. Go make it personal üòâ.
Would you like YABA to create some example folders and tags to help you get started faster?
If you already did this step on another device, enabling it again may create duplicates. Skip it if you're unsure.
YABA autofills the title if possible. Otherwise, you‚Äôll need to enter one before saving.
YABA saves it under 'Uncategorized' ‚Äî easy to find, easier to organize.
Start by sharing the post, article, or link from the app you‚Äôre in.
Look for the three-dot menu to access the native share sheet.
From the native sheet, select YABA to preview and save the link.
Copy the link from your browser or any app to save it with YABA.
Click Share and pick YABA from the menu. The save sheet will open.
Press CMD + SHIFT + Y anytime to bring up the global save sheet.
No ads, no subscriptions, no lifetime unlocks. Ever.
We don't collect anything. Your bookmarks are stored on your device and are only accessible to you.
YABA is fully open-source. You can explore, audit, or contribute anytime.
Bookmarking should be fast and delightful. YABA is designed to stay minimal and intuitive.
This app is crafted with love‚Äînot profit‚Äîin mind. You‚Äôre not a user, you‚Äôre part of the journey.
No dark patterns, no popups, no upsells. Just clean, focused bookmarking.
ü§î Was it in Safari? Instagram? Reddit? You saved it‚Ä¶ somewhere.
That moment of scrolling through app after app just to find one link you vaguely remember.
YABA is here to fix that ü•≥
üóìÔ∏è Your memes, recipes, and deep reads ‚Äî lost in the clutter of 'Saved' lists
You know it‚Äôs there‚Ä¶ but it's buried under randomness and noise.
üè∑Ô∏è Folders? Tags? Most apps act like organization is optional.
You deserve better than a single, endless list of ‚Äòstuff.‚Äô
Open in YABA for more options

Reader Mode is unavailable for this page. The content may be hidden behind a paywall, require a login, be dynamically loaded with JavaScript, or lack a clear article structure. Some websites also restrict access to their content to protect copyrights or user privacy.
